head.title: A Robust Economy Raises Interest Fears

hedline.hl1: A Robust Economy Raises Interest Fears

block.p: The American economy grew at a surprisingly robust 5.2 percent annual rate in the second quarter. The news of the unexpectedly strong growth sent stocks plummeting as investors feared the Federal Reserve might increase interest rates again. The Nasdaq composite index plunged 4.7 percent, finishing the week off 10.5 percent, its third worst week. The Dow Jones industrial average dropped 74.96 points, to 10,511.17, and was down 2.1 percent for the week.

The American economy grew at a surprisingly robust 5.2 percent annual rate in the second quarter. The news of the unexpectedly strong growth sent stocks plummeting as investors feared the Federal Reserve might increase interest rates again. The Nasdaq composite index plunged 4.7 percent, finishing the week off 10.5 percent, its third worst week. The Dow Jones industrial average dropped 74.96 points, to 10,511.17, and was down 2.1 percent for the week.
Consumers, whose spending accounts for most of the $9 trillion economy, reduced spending in the quarter, but the federal government and businesses increased spending.
